page.title: 13Recreation in Rogate
page.content: Hunting is an active pastime in this area, both on horse and foot. When we spoke to the underkeeper for Lord Rosehill he explained that many people come to shoot over that estate. His job was to rear the pheasants and gradually accustom them to the wild without letting the fox get them first. Besides these two creatures he shoots or catches with snares deer, rabbits and vermin. When he sets a trap it is usually a piece of wire with a loop in it, this is always checked once an hour or the animal will have prolonged suffering. His method of catching his prey is to stalk carefully knowing the habits and instincts of the creature, but he does sometimes use a whistle, a meat bait or a decoy which seems to be feeding happily, as an attraction.
